Sudanese paramilitaries try to erase evidence of their crimes in el-Fasher
subhead: Survivors continue to arrive, little by little, from the major Darfur city of el-Fasher, which fell a week ago to Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF). They recount massacres committed there.

title: Behind France's efforts to bring back hostages in Iran, an exchange scenario emerges
subhead: Released Tuesday after three and a half years in detention in Tehran, the couple is prohibited from leaving Iranian territory. Their repatriation appears to hinge on the fate of Mahdieh Esfandiari, an Iranian national living in France, who faces charges of promoting terrorism.

title: Belgium faces security crisis as daily drone overflights spark alarm
subhead: The National Security Council met on Thursday to address a wave of aerial incursions, which have targeted military bases and airports across the country. The heightened tensions come amid political turmoil, as the prime minister struggles to pass a budget.

title: Marlene Dumas becomes first contemporary woman to join the Louvre's permanent collection
subhead: She has exhibited her work in the world's most prestigious museums and her paintings have broken auction records. The Dutch-South African painter has created a body of work shaped by the traumas of her time. At 72, she joins the Louvre with a series of nine portraits. This event illustrates the shift sought by Louvre Director Laurence des Cars, one that she is maintaining even after the institution was the target of a dramatic jewelry heist.

title: The American retirees who benefit from free French social security
subhead: Attracted by French universal health coverage, many Americans have chosen to settle in the country, where they are also exempt from paying income tax.

title: Residents 'stunned' after car-ramming attack on French island leaves five injured
subhead: Driving for 35 minutes, the driver deliberately struck five pedestrians and cyclists. Although he shouted 'Allahu akbar,' he was not known for radicalization. The National Anti-Terrorism Prosecutor's Office is monitoring the situation for now.

title: From California to New York, elections give Democrats a breath of fresh air
subhead: While Tuesday's successes do not solve the party's underlying problems, they do allow it to emerge from the slump that followed its defeat in the presidential election, one year ahead of the midterms.
